node.title: Covid-19 vaccines: Deadline hits for Fire and Emergency, police
node.description: Today is the deadline for Fire and Emergency staff and some police officers to have had two doses of the Covid-19 vaccine.
node.content:
["Today is the deadline for Fire and Emergency staff and some police officers to have had two doses of the Covid-19 vaccine.", "", "
People line up at a Covid-19 vaccination centre Photo: RNZ / Angus Dreaver
", "They are among workers in the health and disability, education, and corrections sectors who work with high-risk populations or settings.", "Vaccinations are also required for those who work within two metres of health practitioners and children for more than 15 minutes at a time.", "Meanwhile, all sworn police officers and Defence Force staff have to have had their first dose by Monday and their second dose by 1 March.", "And managed isolation workers have until the end of this month to get their booster shot.", "As of Wednesday, 40 percent were yet to do so."]
